name: Penn Dairies, Inc., Appellant, v. Milk Control Commission of Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
name_abbreviation: Penn Dairies, Inc. v. Milk Control Commission of Commonwealth

judges: Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
parties: Penn Dairies, Inc., Appellant, v. Milk Control Commission of Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
These appeals are from the judgments of the Superior Court, which affirmed an order of the Court of Common Pleas of Lancaster County. We have carefully considered each question raised and find that they were all correctly and ably disposed of by the learned Superior Court. It would be idle repetition to restate the facts and law of the case. We therefore affirm the judgments on the comprehensive opinion of Judge Kenworthey, reported in 148 Pa. Superior Ct. 261.
Judgments affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Harris G. Arnold, with him Owen P. Briefer, of Arnold & Briolcer, for appellant.
Enoch E. Ellison, with him Francis M. Shea, Assistant Attorney General, Sidney J. Kaplan, Special Assistant Attorney General, Gerald A. Gleeson and J. Barton Rettew, Jr., for intervenor.
Frank E. Goho, Deputy Attorney General, with him Olaude T. Reno, Attorney General, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Penn Dairies, Inc., Appellant, v. Milk Control Commission of Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Argued May 11, 1942.
Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
Harris G. Arnold, with him Owen P. Briefer, of Arnold & Briolcer, for appellant.
Enoch E. Ellison, with him Francis M. Shea, Assistant Attorney General, Sidney J. Kaplan, Special Assistant Attorney General, Gerald A. Gleeson and J. Barton Rettew, Jr., for intervenor.
Frank E. Goho, Deputy Attorney General, with him Olaude T. Reno, Attorney General, for appellee.
May 25, 1942:
